message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CE, cs.PL, cs.MS, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category as it focuses on best software engineering practices for scientific software development. It could also belong to the Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) sub-category as it discusses the importance of reliable and easy-to-use software packages for scientific research. The Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper presents a project skeleton for software development. The Modeling and Simulation (cs.MS) sub-category is relevant as the paper discusses the development of sustainable software packages for scientific research. Finally, the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category is a possibility as the paper may discuss the use of software packages in these fields.
